Substeps.Procedure: User Pam executed payload rcs.3aka3.doc
Substeps.Criteria: The rcs.3aka3.doc process spawning from explorer.exe

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed explorer.exe executing rcs.3aka3.doc.
A General alert detection was generated identifying rcs.3aka3.doc as malware.
Footnotes: According to the vendor, this would have been prevented due to rcs.3aka3.doc being identified as malware.

Detections.Detection_Note: An MSSP detection for "process spawning with an uncommon file extension" occurred containing evidence of explorer.exe executing rcs.3aka3.doc.

Substeps.Procedure: Used unicode right-to-left override (RTLO) character to obfuscate file name rcs.3aka3.doc (originally cod.3aka.scr)
Substeps.Criteria: Evidence of the right-to-left override character (U+202E) in the rcs.3aka.doc process OR the original filename (cod.3aka.scr)

Detections.Detection_Note: A Technique alert detection  (low severity) called "Process Without Common Executable Extension" was generated when an executable file ran without a valid signature created a process.
A MSSP detection for "Process Without Common Executable Extension" occurred containing evidence of an executable file ran without a valid signature creating a process.

Substeps.Procedure: Established C2 channel (192.168.0.5) via rcs.3aka3.doc payload over TCP port 1234

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed the rcs.3aka3.doc process connecting to 192.168.0.5 on TCP port 1234.
Footnotes: Though no image was captured, MITRE confirmed that the vendor has the capability to show available telemetry in a separate view.

Detections.Detection_Note: A Tactic alert detection (low severity) called "Unsigned Application Network Beaconing" was generated when the rcs.3aka3.doc process made a network connection.
An MSSP detection for "Unsigned Application Network Beaconing" occurred containing evidence of rcs.3aka3.doc process connecting to C2(192.168.0.5) on port 1234.

Substeps.Procedure: Used RC4 stream cipher to encrypt C2 (192.168.0.5) traffic
Substeps.Criteria: Evidence that the network data sent over the C2 channel is encrypted

Detections.Detection_Note: Minimum detection criteria was not met for this procedure.

Substeps.Procedure: Spawned interactive cmd.exe
Substeps.Criteria: cmd.exe spawning from the rcs.3aka3.doc process

Subtechnique.Subtechnique_Name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed cmd.exe spawning from rcs.3aka3.doc.
A MSSP detection occurred containing evidence of cmd.exe spawning from rcs.3aka3.doc.

Substeps.Procedure: Spawned interactive powershell.exe

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed powershell.exe spawning from cmd.exe.

Detections.Detection_Note: A Tactic alert detection (info severity) called "Win_User_Execution_MITRET1204" was generated due to a process targeting an *.exe filename.

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed a PowerShell command to add the DelegateExecute Registry Value.
